sentences.english: The first failing, of which Mr Obama in particular is guilty, is misstating the problem.
sentences.chinese: 第一重失误就是谎报病灶，奥巴马难逃其咎。

sentences.english: Some children"will not be completely honest about their age", a spokesman said.
sentences.chinese: 一位发言人表示，一些孩子子“会谎报年龄”。

sentences.english: "I am a ghost too, " Dingbo lied.
When he was sixteen, he lied about his age to participate in the expedition.
sentences.chinese: 16岁时，他谎报年龄参加了远征军。

sentences.english: He lied about his age to join the army.
sentences.chinese: 他为了参军谎报了年龄。

sentences.english: Most Americans are romantics, don't lie about age-poll.
sentences.chinese: 多数美国人是浪漫主义者从不谎报年龄。

sentences.english: The case is now being investigated as filing a false report, a misdemeanor.
sentences.chinese: 警方现已将此案定性为谎报案情的轻罪行为。

sentences.english: Mass media often dissembled the true scale of help from ARA.
sentences.chinese: 大众媒体经常谎报ARA所给予帮助的真实程度。

sentences.english: Cindy tends to lie about her weight and age.
sentences.chinese: 辛迪往往会谎报体重和年龄。

sentences.english: Do you ever lie about your age?
It id known to everyone that Mary lied about his age.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽谎报年龄是尽人皆知的事实。

sentences.english: Some children “will not be completely honest about their age”, a spokesman said.
sentences.chinese: 一位发言人表示，一些孩子“会谎报年龄”。

sentences.english: You should be ashamed of yourself, telling lies at your age.
sentences.chinese: 谎报年龄，你应该为此感到羞耻。

sentences.english: He lied about his reasons for being late.

definition: to conceal or deceive in a report/to falsify by over- or underreporting
to cover up (a matter that should be reported to the authorities)
to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up
to assume sb's name and take his place (idiom); to impersonate/to pose under a false name
to obtain by impersonation/to falsely claim as one's own
to conceal/to hide (a taboo subject)/to cover up the truth
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
